page.title: 08ELMBRIDGE-DAIRY& SHEEP FARMS
page.content: Elmbridge consists of about 27 farms ranging from two to six hundred acres,the average being about one hundred. The soil type is predominantly clay which is used mainly for dairying and sheep. An average dairy herd would be around one hundred cows. These are milked by machine and the milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board. A house cow is kept on one farm. Most old buildings are no longer used for their original purpose and many farms have new buildings to house their stock. Hay and silage is produced from the grass and is used for winter feeding. Silage is stored in large purpose built sheds then covered with polythene to prevent fermenting. Flocks of sheep range from 12 to 500 and are sold to co-operatives and local markets as stores or fat lambs.
